TextpageLeftNav.bodyText:
Stream Analytics

An event processing engine in the cloud can be developed quickly and in real time to deeply understand currently existing data attributes.

Apply for a trial Purchase now

Azure Stream Analysis is an event analysis engine in the cloud, which can deeply understand the equipment, sensors, basic structure of the cloud and attributes of the existing data in real time. By integration with Event Hub, the combined solution can receive millions of events and analyze them when it is carrying out streaming of data in real time, so as to better understand modes and enhance dashboards, or begin executing operations.

Pricing Details

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly price estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.
Price
Standard stream processing unit RMB 0.723/hour

FAQs

Expand all
  • What is the stream processing unit?

    The stream processing unit is a unit of stream processing capacity with a maximum handling capacity of 1MB/s. The number of stream processing units is chosen by the customer through the Azure portal or the stream analysis management API. And the stream processing unit can be used to extend stream processing operations to achieve higher handling capacity. Moreover, more stream processing units may be needed to achieve performance requirements, according to the complexity of the query and the required handling capacity.

    The number of units for the stream processing is charged by the hour, and the billing is based on the maximum number of units chosen in one hour.

  • What are the factors affecting the price of the stream operations?

    The main factors affecting the price of stream operations are the complexity of queries, the return rate (delay) for the queries and the amount of data processed.

  • Is there any limit on the number of stream processing units?

    There is no number limit for the stream processing units. The quota for the default stream processing unit subscribed individually by each region is 48. You can request a larger number of stream processing units by filling in the supporting worker order.

  • Does the running steam require Event Hub during operation?

    It is recommended that Event Hub be used as the transfer center for the scalable event, so as to be regarded as the solution for stream analysis; while currently, stream analysis also supports pulling data from Azure Blob. We may consider integrating with other input sources in the future.

Marketing Regions

Stream analysis service is available in the following regions:

Territories Regions
Mainland China China East Data Center, China North Data Center

Support and Service Level Agreements

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

We guarantee that availability of the stream analysis API is at least 99.9%.

We guarantee that the deployed stream analysis operation will or process data 99.9% of the time.

To learn more about the details about our service level agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.

TextpageLeftNav.pageTitle: Pricing of Stream Analysis Service - Azure Cloud Computing
TextpageLeftNav.metaKeywords: Azure, Microsoft Cloud, Stream Analysis, price, data processing, analysis service, stream processing and RMB 1 trial
TextpageLeftNav.metaDescription: Learn about the price details of Azure stream analysis. Azure Stream Analysis is a real-time cloud service for data analysis. And the stream analysis is priced by the amount of data processed and the number of stream processing units for processing. A 1 RMB Trial gets you RMB 1,500 in service credits. You can also make a direct purchase and become a Pay-in-advance Azure customer to enjoy a service level agreement of up to 99.99%.
